Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Royalisin (XXA; natural AMPs; insects,arthropods,invertebrates,  animals; 3S=S; Deletion variants: Royalisin-D)
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: S-S bonds are essential for peptide antimicrobial activity (BÃ­likova K et al., 2015).

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  Three disulfide bonds.Activity: Active against G+ bacteria S. aureus, S. thermiphylus, L. bulgaricus (MIC 6 ug/ml) (see AP1210 for ref). Also, active against S. aureus (MIC 7.5 ug/ml), S. alactolyticus (MIC 9 ug/ml), S. intermediusB (MIC 4 ug/ml), S. xylosus (MIC 10.5 ug/ml), P. larvae (MIC 6 ug/ml),  Gram- P. aeruginosa (MIC 10 ug/ml), S. cholearasuis (MIC 9 ug/ml), V. parahaemolyticus (MIC 4 ug/ml), and E.coli.Peptide stability:  heat-stable. can be heated 15 min at 100oC.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: interin technology. purified for antimicrobial assay, peptide yield: 1 mg/L.SAR:  Royalisin-D (see AP185), obtained by deleting 11 residues from the C-terminus, showed similar activities to the WT.Updated 7/2014; 3/2015; 12/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Fujiwara S, Imai J, Fujiwara M, Yaeshima T, Kawashima T, Kobayashi K.1990
Literature Information.Title: A potent antibacterial protein in royal jelly. Purification and determination of the primary structure of royalisin.
